title: Fraud & Payment Blog | Outseer
original_summary: This Outseer blog focuses on the future of fraud prevention, emphasizing the use of behavioral biometrics as a strategic signal for improved fraud detection. It also discusses the importance of a coordinated defense framework for banks and nations to effectively combat scams.

title: Report: Why Collaboration Via 3-D Secure is Key to Beating CNP Fraud | Outseer
original_summary: A new study highlights that widespread adoption and collaboration using 3-D Secure (3DS) is key to significantly reducing card-not-present (CNP) fraud, which is projected to cost businesses billions. While 3DS is effective on its own, its benefits are amplified when more merchants, issuers, and networks participate, leading to lower fraud rates and improved checkout experiences. The US lags behind other regions in 3DS adoption, resulting in disproportionately higher CNP fraud losses.

A new study highlights that widespread adoption and collaboration using 3-D Secure (3DS) is key to significantly reducing card-not-present (CNP) fraud, which is projected to cost businesses billions.

title: 3-D Secure July Release: Compliance and Security with New EMV, AmEX SafeKey Certifications, and VISA 3RI Delay and Split Shipment | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer's July 3-D Secure release focuses on enhancing security and compliance for card issuers through certifications for EMVCo 3DS v2.3.1.1 and AmEx SafeKey 2.2, as well as improved VISA 3RI support for complex payment scenarios. These updates aim to reduce fraud, improve the cardholder experience, and ensure adherence to the latest global protocols and card scheme requirements.

These updates aim to reduce fraud, improve the cardholder experience, and ensure adherence to the latest global protocols and card scheme requirements.

title: 3-D Secure: Navigating Compliance Changes | Outseer
original_summary: This blog post discusses the importance of EMVCo's 3-D Secure protocol and Outseer's role in helping businesses navigate the complexities of global, regional, and local compliance requirements for card-not-present payments, including SCA and Sweden's BankID. Outseer's 3-D Secure solution offers adaptable features and expert guidance to ensure businesses can effectively mitigate fraud, meet regulatory obligations, and provide secure, user-friendly transaction experiences.

title: 3-D Secure: Everything You Need to Know | Outseer
original_summary: This blog post explains 3-D Secure (3DS) as a security protocol designed to prevent online fraud by authenticating consumers with their card issuers. Initially cumbersome, the latest versions (3DS 2.x) have significantly improved the user experience with risk-based authentication, leading to higher conversion rates and robust security, while also offering merchant-friendly features like liability shifts and automatic enrollment. Outseer offers a 3DS solution that leverages a risk engine enriched by global data, to better reduce fraud and improve the checkout experience.

Outseer offers a 3DS solution that leverages a risk engine enriched by global data, to better reduce fraud and improve the checkout experience.

title: 3-D Secure Authentication: What It Is & Why It’s Needed | Outseer
original_summary: The blog post explains 3-D Secure authentication as a crucial payment protocol that adds an extra layer of fraud protection for online transactions by verifying customer identity with their card issuer. It highlights the importance of 3-D Secure in combating card-not-present fraud, particularly with the rise of e-commerce, and emphasizes the use of risk assessment and frictionless flows to balance security with a positive customer experience.

title: 5 Post-Pandemic Payments Trends | Outseer
original_summary: The Outseer blog post discusses five post-pandemic payment trends driven by the shift to digital channels and increased customer expectations for fast, secure, and flexible transactions. These trends include the rise of risk-based authentication, the importance of diverse payment options, the growth of embedded finance, and the corresponding increase in transaction fraud that companies must proactively address. Ultimately, innovation and robust fraud prevention are crucial for success in the evolving payments landscape.

title: Accelerating & Protecting Revenue for the Digital Economy | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer emerged to combat the surge in sophisticated fraud accompanying the rapid growth of digital commerce during the pandemic. Leveraging a global fraud data consortium and identity-centric risk graph, Outseer aims to provide advanced payment authentication and account monitoring solutions that protect businesses and customers from evolving cyber threats. The company invites partnerships, talent, and customers to join its mission of securing the digital economy.

title: Account Takeover Protection: Everything You Need to Know | Outseer
original_summary: Account Takeover (ATO) occurs when fraudsters steal credentials to access legitimate accounts, enabling them to conduct unauthorized transactions and steal sensitive information. Effective ATO protection employs machine learning and data science to detect anomalous login behavior and requires a combination of business and consumer actions, including implementing multi-factor authentication, educating users, and utilizing advanced fraud prevention solutions. Outseer offers a solution that leverages these techniques to protect accounts while minimizing user friction.

title: Adaptive Authentication: What Is It & How Does It Work? | Outseer
original_summary: Adaptive authentication dynamically adjusts authentication requirements based on the risk associated with a login or transaction, using factors like location, device, and behavior to differentiate legitimate users from malicious actors. This approach protects against fraud and account takeovers by requiring additional authentication only when suspicious activity is detected, improving security without adding unnecessary friction for genuine users. By leveraging machine learning and customizable risk scores, adaptive authentication offers a more effective and user-friendly alternative to standard authentication methods.
nlp_summary: Adaptive authentication dynamically adjusts authentication requirements based on the risk associated with a login or transaction, using factors like location, device, and behavior to differentiate legitimate users from malicious actors. This approach protects against fraud and account takeovers by requiring additional authentication only when suspicious activity is detected, improving security without adding unnecessary friction for genuine users.

title: Aspen Report: A National Strategy to Prevent Scams | Outseer
original_summary: The Aspen Institute report highlights the escalating threat of consumer scams and proposes a comprehensive national strategy involving government, industry, and civil society. It emphasizes the need for coordinated action, data sharing, and a national "duty of care" framework to prevent scams and disrupt criminal networks, treating it as a national security issue. Key recommendations include government leadership, private sector engagement, and enhanced scam prevention measures across various sectors.

It emphasizes the need for coordinated action, data sharing, and a national "duty of care" framework to prevent scams and disrupt criminal networks, treating it as a national security issue.

title: Enhancing Account Takeover Detection With Identity-centric, Biometric Protections | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer's blog post highlights new biometric enhancements to their Fraud Manager, aimed at bolstering account takeover (ATO) and enrollment fraud prevention. These updates include effortless ID verification using facial recognition during enrollment and FIDO2 compliant biometrics for stronger account compromise protection, all designed to improve security while minimizing user friction. The enhancements are part of the Outseer Beyond™ program, expanding anti-fraud capabilities through third-party partnerships.

title: Enhancing Scalability, Flexibility, and Performance with Advanced RESTful APIs in Fraud Manager Cloud | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer's Fraud Manager Cloud is introducing RESTful APIs to enhance scalability, performance, and integration flexibility for fraud prevention. The dual support for both REST and SOAP APIs streamlines implementation and allows a smooth transition for existing customers while offering new customers faster deployment.

title: Outseer’s Global Data Network: Revolutionising Fraud Prevention through Consortium Data | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer's blog post emphasizes that traditional fraud prevention is not enough in today's digital world, and a data consortium, like Outseer's Global Data Network, offers a revolutionary approach. This network leverages aggregated data, machine learning, and real-time insights from numerous organizations to enhance fraud detection, risk assessment, and overall security in a scalable and cost-effective way.

title: Command & Control Servers: The Rise of the Hook | Outseer
original_summary: The complete leak of the Hook Android banking trojan's source code in late 2023 has led to a surge in its usage, with over 200 new Command & Control servers detected. This leak empowers more threat actors, even those with limited technical skills, to deploy customized Hook variants for fraudulent activities, blurring the lines between established malware groups and "newcomers." Outseer anticipates further evolution and increased sophistication of Hook-based threats, emphasizing the need for proactive detection and termination of malicious servers.
nlp_summary: This leak empowers more threat actors, even those with limited technical skills, to deploy customized Hook variants for fraudulent activities, blurring the lines between established malware groups and "newcomers." Outseer anticipates further evolution and increased sophistication of Hook-based threats, emphasizing the need for proactive detection and termination of malicious servers.

title: Top Strategies for Risk-Based Transaction Monitoring | Outseer
original_summary: Risk-based transaction monitoring uses statistical analysis and machine learning to assign risk scores to transactions, allowing businesses to focus on high-risk activities while minimizing disruption to legitimate customers. Key to effective risk-based monitoring is leveraging diverse data points and global intelligence networks to continuously improve risk models and adapt to new threats. Solutions like Outseer use sophisticated algorithms to provide accurate and transparent risk scoring, enabling businesses to prevent fraud without sacrificing customer experience.
nlp_summary: Key to effective risk-based monitoring is leveraging diverse data points and global intelligence networks to continuously improve risk models and adapt to new threats. Risk-based transaction monitoring uses statistical analysis and machine learning to assign risk scores to transactions, allowing businesses to focus on high-risk activities while minimizing disruption to legitimate customers.

title: Rogue Apps: What They Are & Top Techniques to Prevent Them | Outseer
original_summary: Rogue apps impersonate trusted brands to steal user information and commit fraud, costing individuals and businesses significant money. These malicious apps can install malware, steal credentials, or charge fraudulent fees, and their prevalence is increasing. Businesses and individuals can defend against rogue apps by monitoring app stores for brand impersonation, reviewing app permissions, and only installing apps from official marketplaces.

title: CYBERWARFARE: How the Russia-Ukraine Crisis Threatens Cybersecurity Worldwide | Outseer
original_summary: The Russia-Ukraine crisis has triggered a new era of cyberwarfare, with attacks like DDoS, phishing, and malware targeting both Ukrainian and Russian entities, and potentially impacting global cybersecurity. Organizations worldwide should prepare for a widening blast radius of cyberthreats, including retaliatory nation-state attacks, as the conflict escalates and economic sanctions against Russia increase the risk of cyberattacks against Western targets.

title: Safeguarding Against Malware: Outseer FraudAction’s Role in Countering Stolen Credentials | Outseer
original_summary: The Outseer blog post discusses the increasing threat of malware, including new strains targeting Mac and Windows systems and the rise of "Malware as a Service." It highlights how Outseer FraudAction helps organizations protect against stolen credentials by detecting, preventing, and mitigating the impact of these cyber threats through advanced technologies and real-time surveillance. The post emphasizes the importance of staying informed and proactive in cybersecurity to combat the evolving digital battleground.

title: Safeguarding Businesses and Customers with FraudAction’s Unrivaled Protection Against Cybercrime | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer's FraudAction provides businesses with crucial protection against evolving cybercrime and phishing threats that target customer credentials and data through sophisticated techniques. FraudAction uses adaptive defense strategies, machine learning, and collaborative threat intelligence to detect and neutralize malicious activity, even those employing advanced evasion tactics like Google AMP abuse. By staying ahead of emerging threats, FraudAction empowers organizations to safeguard their assets, reputation, and customers in the complex digital landscape.

title: Safeguarding Financial Data: The Importance of Data Protection | Outseer
original_summary: Financial data is a prime target for cybercriminals, making robust data protection essential for financial institutions. The blog post emphasizes best practices like encryption, access controls, employee training, and incident response planning to mitigate risks and ensure compliance with regulations like PCI DSS, advocating for a strong security posture throughout the financial sector's supply chain. A zero trust strategy is recommended as well as collaboration with industry peers.

title: Safeguarding Your Investments: An Overview of How Outseer Fraud Manager Protects Funding for Cryptocurrency Purchases | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer Fraud Manager protects cryptocurrency investors by securing the initial funding of their crypto accounts, using data science and risk models trained on billions of transactions to detect and prevent fraud. It streamlines the funding process with comprehensive risk insights and consistent security controls, ensuring a safer entry into the crypto market.

title: Scam Mitigation Quick Guide: Your Journey to Protection | Outseer
original_summary: Outseer highlights the rise of scams like authorized push payments and mule accounts, driven by fraudsters exploiting personal information through phishing, vishing, and impersonation. They emphasize the importance of limiting access to customer credentials, tracking scams, introducing smart friction during transactions, and sharing fraud data across organizations to stay ahead of evolving scam tactics. Outseer offers solutions like FraudAction, Fraud Manager, Global Data Network, and Policy Manager to mitigate these threats.

title: Scan & Scam: QR Codes, Touchless Payments & CNP Fraud | Outseer
original_summary: The rise of QR codes for touchless payments presents new opportunities for CNP and ATO fraud, as malicious actors can exploit these codes to redirect users to phishing sites or initiate fraudulent transactions. Businesses need to implement robust verification measures, such as geolocation and behavioral data analysis, to prevent these attacks and protect sensitive customer information. Outseer offers solutions leveraging EMV 3-D Secure and comprehensive data to effectively combat QR code-related fraud and protect businesses' reputations.
